name: Albino Angelfish
description:
The Albino Angelfish, a variant of Pterophyllum scalare, is a unique and eye-catching freshwater fish species known for its lack of melanin pigment, resulting in a pale white or pinkish coloration. This variety of angelfish shares the same elegant body shape and graceful movements as its wild-type counterparts. Albino Angelfish are peaceful and can be kept in community aquariums with other non-aggressive species of similar size.

They thrive in well-planted aquariums with plenty of hiding spots and prefer a water temperature range of 75°F to 82°F. These fish can grow up to 6 inches in length and are known to be good parents, often taking care of their fry.

Chinese Algae Eaters can grow up to 6 inches (15 cm) in length and are best kept in larger tanks to accommodate their size and activity level.
